column5: It's been a while since I've made a post so here's a start of hopefully many more to come  I finally had the chance to get out for some Laker action today after spending last weekend opener at home spreading a tandem load of topsoil around the property top dressing the lawn and making a new perennial garden for the wife....  Left the house at 3:00AM to go meet a buddy and it was windy from the get go ...we had a great sunrise and the weather looked promising with nice clear blue skies but got worse as the day went on!!...we went 2 for 7 and were lucky to get the 2 as a cold front moved in....drove home in a brutal hail storm around noon...  Here's some pics...      The season has only just begun  ....and....Muskie season here on the Ottawa is just around the corner
beautiful looking fish-congrats!  any hints on how deep and the water temp?
Thanks!!  Water temp was 57F and the fish were scattered...they started heading into deeper water as the cold front moved in....I caught this one at 75' in 170FOW and caught a smaller one at 40'..
An excellent cold front fish!!!  ... and another excellent tourney entry!!!  Soon those team 3 whiny babies will be on thier knees to us!!!
Thanks Andrew...   Thanks Glen....a few inches here and there helps the team for sure   ......hopefully I'll be able to contribute a Muskie entry soon which will be a bit more than just a few inches
dark lakers just like you  like them steve!  nice fish . congrats!
Beauty Laker right there Steve.....  Did it end up in the frying pan or back in to swim another day...
A real good looking fish there Steve. When they're dark like that they look so clean. Congrats.
Thanks guys.....she went back into the lake to grow bigger and make more babies  I'm not much of a fish eater except for the odd walleye and small specks....

HAHAHA....your an entertaining chappie Glen...good one!    Great fish there BTW...real nice laker. I cant wait to get my first musky this year, had two invites from some hardcore Muskyhunters who are gonna show me the ropes so to speak.... once again....nice trout!
Great report and pics Steve That is a real beauty!!!! Congratulations Looks kind of nippy out there Thanks for taking the time to post and share with us Jacques
